lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: credit (and savings!) used with conscious awareness creates growth and development for one's self and one's community.
lenders.occupational_info: I educate and advise people, whether they have lots of money or very little, about the rules of money so they can take care of themselves, their families and their communities.  My focus is on lending people money to purchase a home in the U.S.  There are many financial advantages to home ownership in the U.S.  And owning one's home is a powerful experience that empowers people to build their lives and the lives of those around them.  But, it starts with a commitment to financial education whether you ever own a home or not.

lenders.name: Houssein
lenders.loan_because:
My first reason for loaning is that I wanted to do it on behalf of my wife and my 2 daughters. My second reason is that, as a head of household, it is my duty to help when I can and wherever I can.
My third reason is that I am Lebanese and I was born in Senegal where the Djiito family is from. May God bless all of you, helpers and receivers.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a Pharmacy Hospital. My shift is a 10 hour day four times a week. I supervise the work flow and the work of 2 to 3 pharmacy technicians. I also make sure that disease /medication treatment is appropriate and that all medications doses and frequencies are correct all throughout my shift. I mix antibiotics and Chemo therapy agents for all appropriate patients. I also assist the nurses and the physicians in some ambiguities that may occur during their shift to facilitate their demandes that are directly connected to the Pharmacy and their patients. I also fill prescriptions for free for home use to the indigen families that cannot afford to pay. And many more.

lenders.name: Katie

lenders.name: Ines

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.loan_because: Need to purchase office equipement like a computer and printer, table , phone and chair. I also need a USED van for supply distribution.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a GENERAL CONTRACTOR, who supplies office products, construction, maintenance projects and professional services to the Government and the private sector.

lenders.name: Saloni
lenders.loan_because:
As a high school (now college) student, I contribute to Kiva to help woman attain financial stability in developing countries. I also use the principles of economics to spread the risk of my lending portfolio. Using the profits from my own non-profit handicraft business and occasional birthday gifts, I have helped 406 women thus far. I focus on women with low socioeconomic status. I lend the repaid money to other entrepreneurs, creating a perpetual cycle of giving and receiving.

Highlights of my Kiva portfolio
➢ 100% of loans to women
➢ Does not fund loans that promote gambling or alcoholism
➢ 406 loans funded in 29 countries
➢ Smaller amount for each loan to spread the risk and help more women
➢ Favors Kiva MFIs with a 4 or 5 star rating to minimize the risk of defaulted loans 
➢ Focus on entrepreneurs from countries with low per capita income 
➢ Focuses on loans funded in countries with less than 5,000 USD per capita income
➢ Most of my loans on Kiva request less than 1,000 USD


Updated 1/20/14
lenders.occupational_info: I'm just a student who has much more to learn.

In this picture, I am standing in front of a case that I built for my synagogue, to hold an antique wedding canopy. 

Good luck, Hassan!

Want more information? unitarianflames@shaw.ca
lenders.occupational_info: Unitarians believe we are all part of an interconnected web of life so reaching out to help others will help us all.
